00020 // Increment as appropriate every time you release a new version
00021 #define AUDACITY_VERSION   1
00022 #define AUDACITY_RELEASE   3
00023 #define AUDACITY_REVISION  6
00024 #define AUDACITY_MODLEVEL  0
00025 #define AUDACITY_SUFFIX    wxT("a6") // wxT("-alpha_") __TDATE__ 
00026 
00027 #define AUDACITY_MAKESTR( x ) #x
00028 #define AUDACITY_QUOTE( x ) AUDACITY_MAKESTR( x )
00029 
00030 // Version string for visual display
00031 #define AUDACITY_VERSION_STRING wxT( AUDACITY_QUOTE( AUDACITY_VERSION ) ) wxT(".") \
00032                                 wxT( AUDACITY_QUOTE( AUDACITY_RELEASE ) ) wxT(".") \
00033                                 wxT( AUDACITY_QUOTE( AUDACITY_REVISION ) ) \
00034                                 AUDACITY_SUFFIX
00035 
00036 // Version string for file info (under Windows)
00037 #define AUDACITY_FILE_VERSION AUDACITY_QUOTE( AUDACITY_VERSION ) "," \
00038                               AUDACITY_QUOTE( AUDACITY_RELEASE ) "," \
00039                               AUDACITY_QUOTE( AUDACITY_REVISION ) "," \
00040                               AUDACITY_QUOTE( AUDACITY_MODLEVEL )

00042 // Increment this every time the prefs need to be reset
00043 // the first part (before the r) indicates the version the reset took place
00044 // the second part (after the r) indicates the number of times the prefs have been reset within the same version
00045 #define AUDACITY_PREFS_VERSION_STRING "1.1.1r1"
00046 
00047 // Don't change this unless the file format changes
00048 // in an irrevocable way

00074 /* Magic for dynamic library import and export. This is unfortunately
00075  * compiler-specific because there isn't a standard way to do it. Currently it
00076  * works with the Visual Studio compiler for windows, and for GCC 4+. Anything
00077  * else gets all symbols made public, which gets messy */
00078 /* The Visual Studio implementation */
00079 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00080    #ifndef AUDACITY_DLL_API
00081       #ifdef BUILDING_AUDACITY
00082          #define AUDACITY_DLL_API _declspec(dllexport)
00083       #else
00084          #ifdef _DLL
00085             #define AUDACITY_DLL_API _declspec(dllimport)
00086          #else
00087             #define AUDACITY_DLL_API
00088          #endif
00089       #endif
00090    #endif
00091 #endif //_MSC_VER
00092 
00093 /* The GCC-elf implementation */
00094 #ifdef HAVE_VISIBILITY // this is provided by the configure script, is only
00095 // enabled for suitable GCC versions
00096 /* The incantation is a bit weird here because it uses ELF symbol stuff. If we 
00097  * make a symbol "default" it makes it visible (for import or export). Making it
00098  * "hidden" means it is invisible outside the shared object. */
00099    #ifndef AUDACITY_DLL_API
00100       #ifdef BUILDING_AUDACITY
00101          #define AUDACITY_DLL_API __attribute__((visibility("default")))
00102       #else
00103          #define AUDACITY_DLL_API __attribute__((visibility("default")))
00104       #endif
00105    #endif
00106 #endif
00107 
00108 /* The GCC-win32 implementation */
00109 // bizzarely, GCC-for-win32 supports Visual Studio style symbol visibility, so
00110 // we use that if building on Cygwin
00111 #if defined __CYGWIN__ && defined __GNUC__
00112    #ifndef AUDACITY_DLL_API
00113       #ifdef BUILDING_AUDACITY
00114          #define AUDACITY_DLL_API _declspec(dllexport)
00115       #else
00116          #ifdef _DLL
00117             #define AUDACITY_DLL_API _declspec(dllimport)
00118          #else
00119             #define AUDACITY_DLL_API
00120          #endif
00121       #endif
00122    #endif
00123 #endif
00124 
00125 // For compilers that support precompilation, includes "wx/wx.h".
00126 // Mainly for MSVC developers.
00127 //
00128 // This precompilation is only done for non-unicode debug builds.  
00129 // The rationale is that this is where there is the big time saving
00130 // because that's what you build whilst debugging.
00131 // Whilst disabling precompilation for other builds will ensure
00132 // that missing headers that would affect other platforms do get 
00133 // seen by MSVC developers too.
00134 
00135 #ifndef UNICODE
00136 #ifdef __WXDEBUG__
00137 //#include <wx/wxprec.h>
00138 #endif
00139 #endif
